Juergen Umbrich wrote:
>> Note though that we still use Heritrix 1.14.x for our production crawls 
>> of all sizes.
>>   
> Is it because heritrix 2.0.1 (or 2.0.2) is to unstable, or what is your 
> reason?

2.0.x has a lot of new things that could be destabilizing, but we don't 
know of any particular fatal problems, and we have done some sizable 
test crawls and heard of outside successes with nontrivial crawls.

However, we haven't moved it into production for 2 related reasons:

(1) inertia: our current internal projects don't yet need the new things 
in 2.0.x;

(2) the configuration formats and UI is much changed, with some rough 
edges, and require some translation and relearning to use. But, we are 
making another round of significant changes for 2.2. So rather than 
adjust twice, we intend to skip straight from 1.14.x to 2.2.x. And, 
unless people specifically need features only in 2.0.x, we'd recommend 
the same for others.

> OK, related to the information above, we run several new benchmark 
> crawls with a seed set of around 1M URIs.
> In all the different test runs we had no problems.
> We fetched ~10M page/day and the whole system did not show a unormalities.
> So, we think that the seed report generation, Gordon mentioned, is the 
> problem for the crashing of heritrix in the previous test runs.
> 
> Thanks again for the help!

Glad to hear you've had more success, and you're welcome!

- Gordon @ IA
